title: TO MRS. HAWTHORNE
content: TO MRS. HAWTHORNE Boston, July 3d, 3? o'clock Dearest Wife, Mr. Fields tells me that a proof sheet was sent to Concord to-day, and he wishes it to be sent to him in Boston, so that I may look over it on Monday. You must put two one-cent postage stamps. This has been a terrifically hot day. I shall leave for Concord (N. H.) at five o'clock, and shall mail this scribble there, so that you may know that I have arrived safely. With love to the old people, Thine, N. H.
